app.name: Nexonoma
app.tagline: Discover concepts, methods, tools, and architectures.

hero.description: Your visual guide through the jungle of methods, tools, and patterns. Nexonoma provides structure and orientation exactly where you are in the process.

method.title: C4 Model
method.description: Visualization of architecture on four levels.

valueProps.title: From chaos to clarity
valueProps.description: Nexonoma is not a database, but an intelligent navigation system for complex environments.

alternatives.title: Find alternatives
alternatives.description: Instead of isolated tools, Nexonoma shows suitable patterns and technologies for your specific context.

context.title: Understand context
context.description: See how business requirements, code quality, and team structures (Conway’s Law) are connected.

risks.title: Reduce risks
risks.description: Avoid costly wrong decisions by making dependencies and tech debt traps visible.

catalogSection.title: The Knowledge Catalog
catalogSection.description: No more outdated wikis and link collections. Nexonoma is your single source of truth.

inventory.title: Centralized inventory
inventory.description: 150+ curated building blocks. Concepts, methods, and tools in one place – always up to date and searchable.

semantic.title: Semantically connected
semantic.description: Understand relationships: Which tool fits which method? Which technology supports which concept?

navigations.title: Choose your perspective
navigations.description: Three views for different questions. Dive deep into your knowledge network.

grid.title: Grid view
grid.description: The structured catalog. All building blocks hierarchically organized for quick access.

matrix.title: Matrix view
matrix.description: Systemic analysis. Filters and relationships in the context of cluster × segments.

city.title: City view
city.description: The visual exploration journey. Capture relationships spatially and intuitively.

ctaBottom.title: Ready for better decisions?
ctaBottom.description: Nexonoma is currently in proof-of-concept status. Your feedback helps us build the ultimate tool for architects.

macro.title: Knowledge domains
macro.description: The top-level structure of the knowledge network. These domains bundle related topics into thematic spaces – from strategy and architecture to users and context.

clusters.description: Explore the specific subject areas within this knowledge domain.
clusters.empty: No clusters are currently defined in this domain.

segments.empty: No content found for the selected filters.

matrix.title: Matrix view
matrix.description: Explore the knowledge map in a matrix-based view.

city.title: City view
city.description: Explore the knowledge map in a city-like view.

page.heading: Nexonoma Catalog
page.description: All content building blocks (concepts, methods, tools, technologies) in a compact overview. Search, filter by type, and switch directly to the detail view.

search.placeholder: Search by name or short description...

messages.error: Catalog data could not be loaded: {error}
messages.empty: No entries found. Adjust filters or search term.

ENTERPRISE.label: Enterprise
ENTERPRISE.description: Company-wide and strategic level. Affects enterprise structures, policies, governance, business models, or enterprise architecture decisions.

DOMAIN.label: Domain
DOMAIN.description: Business or product level. Refers to business units, product lines, functional responsibilities, or domain architectures.

TEAM.label: Team
TEAM.description: Operational level of individual teams or departments. Focus on concrete implementation, development, operations, and daily practice.

DRAFT.label: Draft
DRAFT.description: A draft that is not yet complete or reviewed.

REVIEW.label: Review
REVIEW.description: An asset that is ready for review.

PUBLISHED.label: Published
PUBLISHED.description: An asset that is published and available for use.

ARCHIVED.label: Archived
ARCHIVED.description: An asset that has been archived and is no longer actively used.

EXPLORATORY.label: Exploratory
EXPLORATORY.description: Experimental, low adoption, and limited practical experience. Use with caution.

EMERGING.label: Emerging
EMERGING.description: Growing usage with initial validated practical experience.

ESTABLISHED.label: Established
ESTABLISHED.description: Proven, widely adopted, and supported by stable best practices.

DEPRECATED.label: Deprecated
DEPRECATED.description: No longer recommended. Replacement or retirement is planned.

FOUNDATION.label: Foundation
FOUNDATION.description: Basic structures and processes are established.

ADVANCED.label: Advanced
ADVANCED.description: Optimized and agile structures that adapt to market changes.

MEDIUM.label: Medium
MEDIUM.description: Moderate complexity with reasonable learning effort.

LOW.label: Low
LOW.description: Intuitive to understand, minimal learning effort.

TECHNICAL.label: Technical
TECHNICAL.description: Affects technical aspects of the system.

DESIGN_DECISION.label: Design
DESIGN_DECISION.description: Affects decisions at the design or pattern level.

BUILD.label: Build
BUILD.description: Development and implementation of the asset.

RUN.label: Run
RUN.description: Operation and maintenance of the asset.

ITERATE.label: Iterate
ITERATE.description: Iterative improvement and optimization of the asset.

maturityLevel.label: Maturity
maturityLevel.description: Maturity describes how established, stable, and practice-proven an AssetBlock is in real-world usage. It considers market adoption, experience, and available best practices.

cognitiveLoad.label: Cognitive load
cognitiveLoad.description: Cognitive load indicates how much mental effort and knowledge is required to effectively understand and apply the AssetBlock. It considers conceptual complexity, required expertise depth, and learning curve.

complexityLevel.label: Complexity
complexityLevel.description: Complexity describes the level of difficulty in implementing and using the AssetBlock. It considers factors such as the number of involved components, their interactions, and required skills.

impacts.label: Impact area
impacts.description: The impact area indicates which domains (technical, business, organizational) are affected by introducing and using the AssetBlock.

decisionType.label: Decision type
decisionType.description: Decision type describes which kinds of decisions (design, architectural, organizational, technical) are affected by applying the AssetBlock.

organizationalMaturity.label: Organizational maturity
organizationalMaturity.description: Organizational maturity indicates at which level (enterprise, domain, team) the AssetBlock can be applied most effectively.

integrations.label: Integrations
integrations.description: List of systems, platforms, or tools with which this AssetBlock can be integrated.

principles.label: Principles
principles.description: Core principles and heuristics for using, designing, and evaluating the AssetBlock.

valueStreamStage.label: Value stream stage
valueStreamStage.description: The phase in the value stream (discovery, build, run, iterate) in which the AssetBlock is primarily used.

organizationalLevel.label: Organizational level
organizationalLevel.description: The level within the organization (enterprise, domain, team) at which the AssetBlock is applied.

status.label: Status
status.description: The current lifecycle status of the AssetBlock reflecting its development and usage state.

useCases.label: Use cases
useCases.description: Describes specific scenarios in which the AssetBlock is applied, including required inputs and expected outputs.

name.label: Name
name.description: Descriptive title of the use case summarizing its purpose and context.

inputs.label: Inputs
inputs.description: Required inputs, prerequisites, or starting artifacts for this use case.

outputs.label: Outputs
outputs.description: Results, artifacts, or outcomes produced by this use case.

scenarios.label: Scenarios
scenarios.description: Detailed flows or stories illustrating how the AssetBlock is applied in real situations.

name.label: Name
name.description: Title of the scenario describing the situation or context.

context.label: Context
context.description: The context in which the scenario takes place.

steps.label: Steps
steps.description: The steps carried out in the scenario.

risks.label: Risks
risks.description: List of potential risks, challenges, or downsides associated with implementing or using the AssetBlock.

bestPractices.label: Best practices
bestPractices.description: Recommended approaches, strategies, or methods for effectively using the AssetBlock.

inputs.label: Inputs
inputs.description: List of required inputs, prerequisites, or starting artifacts for using the AssetBlock.

outputs.label: Outputs
outputs.description: List of results, artifacts, or outcomes produced by using the AssetBlock.

resources.label: Resources
resources.description: References to supporting materials, documentation, or tools for using the AssetBlock.

name.label: Name
name.description: The title or name of the resource.

shortDescription.label: Short description
shortDescription.description: A concise summary of the AssetBlock highlighting its purpose and key characteristics.

longDescription.label: Detailed description
longDescription.description: A detailed explanation of the AssetBlock including its functions, benefits, and application areas.

benefits.label: Benefits
benefits.description: List of key benefits and value provided by implementing and using the AssetBlock.

limitations.label: Limitations
limitations.description: Known constraints, boundaries, or situations where the AssetBlock may not work optimally.

tradeoffMatrix.label: Trade-offs
tradeoffMatrix.description: Overview of the main trade-offs and considerations when using the AssetBlock.

dimension.label: Dimension
dimension.description: Decision dimension defining the perspective of this trade-off.

pros.label: Pros
pros.description: List of concrete advantages related to this decision dimension.

cons.label: Cons
cons.description: List of concrete disadvantages or risks related to this decision dimension.

metrics.label: Metrics
metrics.description: List of relevant metrics and indicators for measuring performance, effectiveness, or impact of the AssetBlock.

description.label: Description
description.description: A short explanation of the metric and its meaning.

examples.label: Examples & implementations
examples.description: Concrete examples and case studies illustrating the application of the AssetBlock in real projects or organizations.

name.label: Name
name.description: The title or name of the example.

description.label: Description
description.description: A brief explanation of the example and its context.

implementationSteps.label: Implementation steps
implementationSteps.description: Step-by-step guidance for implementing the AssetBlock in a project or organization.

techDebts.label: Technical debt
techDebts.description: Identified technical debts, bottlenecks, or potential issues related to the AssetBlock.

bottleneckTags.label: Bottlenecks
bottleneckTags.description: Describes specific bottlenecks or challenges related to the AssetBlock.

misuseExamples.label: Misuse examples
misuseExamples.description: Examples of incorrect or suboptimal usage of the AssetBlock leading to problems or undesired outcomes.

traps.label: Traps
traps.description: Common pitfalls or mistakes that should be avoided when implementing or using the AssetBlock.

requiredSkills.label: Required skills
requiredSkills.description: List of skills, knowledge, or competencies required to effectively use the AssetBlock.

architecturalDrivers.label: Architectural drivers
architecturalDrivers.description: Key factors or requirements influencing the design and use of the AssetBlock.

constraints.label: Constraints
constraints.description: Known limitations, conditions, or constraints that must be considered when using the AssetBlock.

maturity.description: Maturity of the AssetBlock in terms of market adoption, practical usage, and stability.
maturity.examples:
Exploratory: Experimental
Emerging: Growing adoption
Established: Widely used

cognitiveLoad.description: The mental effort required to understand and apply the AssetBlock.
cognitiveLoad.examples:
Low: Intuitive
Medium: Architectural knowledge
High: Systemic understanding

name.description: Descriptive title of the use case summarizing its purpose and context.

inputs.description: Required inputs, prerequisites, or starting artifacts for this use case.

outputs.description: Results, artifacts, or outcomes produced by this use case.

errors.notFoundText: The page you are looking for does not exist.
